comment.author: 54759089@N00
comment._content: I dont know if I already told you, but I am involved in YDNA research and my YDNA resembles that of a lot of Mennonite families. Warkentin, Quiring, Wieler, Bergen, etc.

comment.author: 52529054@N06
comment._content: How interesting!  Have the paper records indicated a relationship to Mennonites as well?

comment.author: 54759089@N00
comment._content:
Not of my family in any way. We are roman catholic farmers of Brabant since at least 1300.

But the Mennonites are Dutch - Flemish anyway. The YDNA confirms that.

comment.author: 52529054@N06
comment._content: That makes sense.  The Russian Mennonites (the names you provided are all Russian Mennonite names) originated in the Netherlands and later migrated to Russia and beyond.  Of course, Menno Simons himself started out as a Catholic priest....
